pros: I am a senior executive of Palomar Health and have worked with the leaders of Arch since it was started in 2010.  In 2014 my position changed, when our CEO changed,  and I began working much more closely with the leadership team of Arch .   The collaboration between the medical group and hospital was incredible.  Their leadership was always willing to go the distance in supporting high quality clinical services while they were faced with the incredible task of moving the medical group into high performance.  As a hospital leader, I always enjoyed working with the leaders of Arch and commend them for supporting Palomar and our Mission.
cons: None.  Arch is a high quality medical group with excellent leaders striving to make a difference in our community!

review_title: I speak from MY experience...not for everyone.
pros: Our doctors are amazing – and we have great staff. Many of them have worked here for a long time.  I feel like our team is a family.
cons:
When I write these – I am speaking for myself.  I am not sure why Gotham city felt the need to speak for all of Arch.  I do know that Arch is going through a lot of changes.  They are seemingly all good, but we probably won’t know the outcome for some time.  But, change is difficult for a lot of people and those are the ones that are unhappy and leaving.  Some doctors are leaving as well, and I think that is hard on the patients.  From what I heard, the doctors are leaving because they want to find more money.  
My office is busy.  If someone doesn’t like the hustle and bustle of a busy office – they will not make it here.  They expect you to know and do a lot. For someone like me, that keeps the day exciting and I look up and its already time to go home.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Escondido, CA
pros: I would say there are some cool people to work with, but even then it's not much of a "pro"
cons: They just keep throwing work at you for less pay

pros: The Doctor's that work there are very hardworking, and compassionate.  They are in the same building so easy access when you have your appointments.  The employees working there are very friendly and helpful, which helped during my first couple of weeks there.
cons: It was a difficult place to work as a new Executive Director had been hired to clean house, and boy did she clean house!  From the top Executives all the way down.  I believe it could have been handled in a more humane way, but it was slice and dice.

pros:
Urgent Care staff
Medical/Clinical staff & PSR's (patient facing employees) were fantastic. 
Good place to start your work experience but don't plan on sticking around.
cons:
Staffing imbalance (Too many Chiefs not enough Indians)
  Closed door policy with upper management
The CEO ruled as a dictator. She cared more about the bottom line than she did the employees and patients.  She would come into meetings, speak and then run off back to her office to lock herself away (much like a celebrity would).

Horrible pay
No room for growth
Fridays at 2pm: Living in a constant state of "who's getting laid off today"
Overworked; no overtime allowed for unmanageable workloads.

pros: The only Pro is that there are really good people in this organization.
cons: Management simply chooses NOT to treat their people as though they matter. Employees in certain areas are treated  as if they have no benefit to the company. People are afraid to speak up to HR for fear of retribution. (this is a justified fear). Keep hoping that managemnet wakes up to smell the coffee before they loose any more good people.

pros: locations, several available. Lots of open jobs at any given time. You can do things that aren't your job if you want to learn them.
cons: Manager not available most days, non-responsive, no review process ever applied for goals, objectives or performance.  Many employees leaving or laid off each month.  Uniforms required for employees who don't interact with patients (not public-facing). CEO never interacts or speaks with employees, time off denied repeatedly.  Director and C-levels are unresponsive even to basic email questions or requests.  Workplace culture is very poor-to-extremely negative. No benefits offered if part-time, even though this is a healthcare company.  Lighting is harsh so that employees must wear glasses or visors.

pros:
Laid back environment. Close to home. Nice doctors. Not much experience needed. 
Age is no factor. UrgCare on grounds. All departments in the same building.
cons:
Low pay/cliques/complaints when wanting time off. Weak management. Keeps troublesome employees. All about numbers.
Uncaring/zero advancement/constant changes. High turnover. Need better training. 
Need updated computers.

review_title: Arch is the new Gotham City
pros: The only Pros I can think of working at Arch Health Partners is the co-workers but this excludes management. The people who work for this company are one of the most hardworking people ever. The cafeteria at Palomar hospital is great.
cons: The  top management do not care about their employees. You have employees including providers leaving the company at a extreme rate. If you do not care about your providers, How are you treating your patients? What about patient care? Arch only hires employees from a temp agency so that they do not have to pay healthcare insurance due to the affordable care act. Every new employee is from a temp agency and they are not your top candidates for the job. If you work at Arch Supervisors and Managers will always do your performance evaluation late. For the past 10 years it has always been late that means no raises on time. My colleagues who were layoff reported Arch to the Labor board. If you were to leave the company you would not get any retro pay for raises because they are always behind on performance evaluations, this works in their favor.  Management think they're always right but in reality they do not know how to manage. They have the wrong people in the Top level management positions. Management are doing a horrible job. The company has layoff or fired almost 25% of the company staff and are hoping they can continue to provided the same service with less staff. Management always talk about being transparent but management keeps telling their staff lies after lies during the 6:30 am company-wide meetings. The directors and executives mention no massive layoff but in the end if you add up the amount of employees who are let go, its a massive layoff. People lively hoods are on the line, and the company doesn't care one bit. This goes for the patients too because this is the same way how Arch kicks their patients to the curb.

pros: employees are awesome, certain supervisor are awesome too.
cons: they have no structure and the pay sucks the only way you'll make real money is if you move up and if they don't like you forget about it.
